title: Tomb Ship
author: Gordon Reenie & Emma Beeby
filename: 186 - Tomb Ship - Gordon Reenie & Emma Beeby_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
1: INT. TRAP CORRIDOR
(FX: FOOTSTEPS MOVING CAUTIOUSLY IN AN ECHOING STONE CORRIDOR,
CRACKLING OF FLAME TORCH)
FX: RADIO STATIC — LOUD
(STARTS) Ah!
(ON RADIO, ANNOYED) You through yet?
No, Mother. If I were, I’d have called... assuming my head was still attached to my body.
(ON RADIO) You better not be standing there doing nothing. I taught you better than that.
(INTO RADIO) I’m not doing nothing! (FX: BEGINS MOVING OFF, TO END OF CORRIDOR, THROUGH) I just haven’t found the way through yet, that’s all.
(ON RADIO) It’s there. It has to be.
(INTO RADIO) Wait, I think I can [see it]
(FX: INTERRUPTED BY WHOOSH AND CLANK OF METAL HITTING STONE, A BEAT, THEN AGAIN — LIKE AN OBSTACLE IN A PLATFORM GAME)
(ON RADIO) Well, boy?
(AFRAID) Found it.
FX: ANOTHER WHOOSH-CLANK
(ON RADIO) So what are you waiting for?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 3
There’s something in the way. (TO SELF) It’s impossible!
FX: WHOOSH-CLANK; CONTINUES REGULARLY THROUGH:
(ON RADIO) Don’t give me impossible, boy.
(INTO RADIO) How is getting past a giant metal block slamming against the floor every couple of seconds not impossible?
(ON RADIO) There’ll be a way. There has to be!
(INTO RADIO) Just let me think, will you?
(ON RADIO) Rek. Rek! Don’t you talk to me in that [tone of voice]
(FX: CUT OFF BY RADIO STATIC, BRIEF FOOTSTEPS, WHOOSH-CLANK
(TO SELF) Peace at last. OK, think, Rek. Think!
FX: BURST OF STATIC FROM RADIO
(ON RADIO) You’re wrong, Rek.
(INTO RADIO) I said, just let me — wait. You’re not Mother! Who is this?
(ON RADIO) I said, you’re wrong. It’s not impossible.
(ALARMED) Who are you? Where are you?
(ON RADIO) Stand under it. Then you’1ll see how impossible it is. (LAUGHS)
(INTO RADIO) Great idea. Why don’t you go first?
(ON RADIO) I did.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 4
(INTO RADIO) What, you’re on the other side? —
(ON RADIO) Be brave. Find out.
(INTO RADIO) It’s not a hologram.
(ON RADIO) No.
(INTO RADIO) — Ohh, I get it, there must be a pressure pad hidden in the floor. And if I stand on top of it...
FX: HIS BRIEF FOOTSTEPS, WHOOSH-CLANK GETS LOUDER
(ON RADIO) You’re quite sure, are you?
FX: WHOOSH-CLANK, LOUDER STILL
Yes — it’s so obvious!
(OFF, CLOSING IN) Go ahead, then. Brave boy.
FX: WHOOSH-CLANK, RIGHT ON TOP OF US
Here I go. (DEEP BREATH) Three, two, one — (DASHES)
FX: WHOOSH - AND THEN A DEFINITIVE CRUNCH WITH THE CLANK
A BEAT OR TWO, THEN —
CROSS TO:
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 5
2: INT. UPPER CORRIDOR
FX: STATIC FROM VIRNA’S RADIO
(INTO RADIO) Rek? Where are you, boy? What’s taking so long? — Rek!!
FX: SUDDEN CRACKLE FROM VIRNA’S RADIO
(ON RADIO) That’s another one gone, Virna. You still think it’s meant for you, this place?
(INTO RADIO, FURIOUS) Who is this? What have you done with Rek?
(ON RADIO, LAUGHING) Me? - Nothing. Your stupid boy just chose to place himself between a giant slab of metal, and the floor. I can’t imagine why.
(INTO RADIO) What-?!
(ON RADIO) How many more boys do you have to spare? Shall we find out? Because I’m telling you, Virna — keep going, and Rek won’t be the last.
FX: RADIO CUTS OUT
(INTO RADIO) No! No, don’t you dare cut out on me —
(APPROACHING) Was that Rek? He get through?
(STARTLED) Hisko! — Never mind Rek. What about you and Heff? You made any progress with that wall?
No, Mother.
Perhaps, and it’s only a theory, perhaps that’s because you’re not trying hard enough.
We have been, but there doesn’t seem to be a way around, and the stone’s too thick to break. Heff reckons we need to go back to the other trap.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 6
(LOUD) I don’t want to hear what your idiot brother reckons. All I want to hear is the sound of that wall being hammered. (CALLING OUT) You hear that, Heff?
FX: BEAT — THEN LUMPHAMMER AGAINST STONE, OFF
Good. (TO HISKO, KINDLY) I know I’m hard on you boys, but we can’t afford to get sidetracked. You know what’s waiting for us inside. It’s meant for us.
The family.
Me and my boys. And no-one else. So use some muscle and get hammering!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 7
3: INT. CORRIDOR TO GALLERY ENTRANCE
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES, DOOR OPENS, NYSSA THEN DOCTOR EXIT
(SURPRISED) Oh!
(CLOSING DOOR; JIGGLES IT TO MAKE CATCH FIT) That’s odd, the door catch is sticking — (FX: CLICKS SHUT) There, that’s got Ete
Maybe you should open it again.
Doubtless just a spot of molecular expansion caused by a sudden
change in local humidity. I’m sure it’1l sort itself out.
I meant, so we can see something-?
(REALISATION) Yes, it is rather dark. Black as the Void of Camilatros, in fact.
Well, we’re not in the Void of Camilatros now.
I should hope not. That was a bad day. I lost a shoe.
Most likely we’re only gone as far as the cellar of Mr Whitlock’s house.
Let’s find out, shall we?
FX: SCRAPE ON STONE, BRIEF HIGH PITCHED HUM AS LIGHTS COME ON
There. Much better.
You could see the light switch in the dark?
No, but I could hear it. Just the faintest photon hum. It’s not
strictly a switch, rather a photon converter. Creating light from air molecules.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 8
Very advanced. But with stone walls. Perhaps we’re underground.
(FX: BRIEF FOOTSTEPS TO WALL) Perhaps...
Can you hear the wall talk, too?
(EAR TO WALL) No, but if you put your ear to it, it does tell you something.
Which is?
Let’s go and see for ourselves, shall we? Come on.
FX: THEY WALK OFF
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 9
4: INT. UPPER CORRIDOR
(FX: TWO HAMMERS HITTING STONE, CRACKLE OF TORCHES, SOUNDS OF
(PACING, IRRITATED) Murs isn’t back yet.
(BREAKING OFF) Why don’t you buzz him?
Mind your own task, Hisko.
FX: HAMMER IMPACT, LOUD CRACKING OF STONE
That’s it!
Out the way, Heff. Let me see! (FX: BRIEF RUSH OF FOOTSTEPS, CRACKLE OF FLAME TORCH) (REALISATION) But this isn’t —
Another layer of granite under the first. (DEFIANT) I told you, Mother. There’s no way through the wall.
No! I was sure. There has to be! (FX: FLAMES SWOOSHING FROM
See? We should go back. And then we should leave.
No. We just need to find another way.
You find it, then. There’s traps in every direction except one — the way back. That’s where I’m going. You coming, Hisko?
Well...
(CALM) Stay where you are, Hisko.
Um, okay.
I’m doing this for the family, Heff. Don’t you want the best for our family?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 10
What family?! When we got here, I had two more brothers than I do now. You keep saying Rek is coming back, but I know he isn’t. And then there was what happened to Biss...
That wasn’t Mother’s fault!
And where’s Murs?
Murs has what it takes. He’ll be fine. You could do with trying to be more like your brother. Try not being a coward.
I’m no coward.
Prove it. Because there’s no going back.
We could get help and come back.
You know family rules. No outsiders.
Hey, where’s that light coming from?
FX: RUSHING FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING, OFF
Arm yourselves! Now!
FX: ENERGY PISTOLS ACTIVATING
(CALLING OUT) Identify yourself!
(OFF) Don’t shoot! It’s me — Murs!
Murs is back! Look, Heff. He really is fine. Heff’s sorry, Mother. Aren’t you, Heff?
Be quiet, boy. (TO MURS) Murs, what’s the matter?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 11
(APPROACHING, BREATHLESS) Mother. There’s.. there’s someone else here.
The.. things. We know.
Not them. People. In the Upper Levels. I heard them, from a distance. I came straight back here.
(NOT MASSIVELY SURPRISED) People, is it.
A man and a woman.
We’re not alone, then.
Mother? You’re not surprised? Why is it you’re not [surprised]
I’m not scared, that’s what I’m not. Murs, show me the way to these... ‘people’.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 12
5: INT. CORRIDOR TO GALLERY ENTRANCE
FX: DOCTOR AND NYSSA FOOTSTEPS
This passage seems to go on forever. Where are we going to end up?
I have a theory about that.
And you don’t want to ruin the surprise. I know you too well, Doctor.
(PUT OUT) Oh. Do you really think so, [Nyssa?]
(CUTTING IN) There’s something up ahead. Do you see? Against the wall. It looks like a person.
If it is, they’re not moving.
They could be hurt. (FX: RUNNING; DOCTOR FOLLOWS) (CALLS OUT) Are you alright? Don’t move, we’re coming to help— [you]
(INTERRUPTING, SLOWING) Nyssa. I don’t think they’re alright.
(GASPS, STOPPING) Oh, how horrible!
There’s almost nothing left.
Do you think it was one of the people who made this place?
(EXAMINING THE BODY) No. Decomposition has taken a few years, maybe a decade or two. This place has been here a lot longer than this chap.
What killed him?
Too little left to tell.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 13
Doctor, you don’t have to pretend. There are teethmarks on the bones.
Looks more like a mark made by mandibles. Very large mandibles.
Some sort of giant insect? I’m beginning to like this place less and less.
Just a little further. If I’m right about this place, it’1l be worth it.
Left or right, then?
Left, I think.
FX: AS THEY MOVE OFF, CROSS TO:
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 14
6: INT. CORRIDOR TO GALLERY ENTRANCE [20 FEET BACK]
(SOTTO) It’s alright, they’re heading away from us.
Not what you were expecting, Mother?
(SOTTO) Shh! — You heard the man, Heff. He thinks he knows what’s in here. So we better make sure they don’t get to it first, hadn’t we?
I don’t know, I thought they just sounded lost...
Ssh!
No need to whisper, they’ve gone now.

We’re taking no chances. It’s obvious where they’re going. Heff, you’re with me. Hisko, Murs — you take the long way round. Follow this corridor, turn right at the end and it’ll lead to the gallery. Make sure they don’t get away from us. And keep quiet!
But what do we do if we see those... things?! (GETS HIT BY MURS) Ow!
Quiet!
Thank you, Murs. And don’t waste all your ammo on “those
things”. We may need it for our new friends.
FX: HISKO & MURS HEAD OFF
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 15
7: INT. GALLERY
(FX: DOCTOR AND NYSSA ENTER AND STOP, ECHOES OF VERY LARGE ROOM)
(GASPS) That’s much more of a spectacle.
Isn’t it just? I rather think we’ve found the way in, Nyssa.
The way in to what?
Well, if I were building a giant tomb complex, this is definitely the kind of room I’d put at the front.
The ceiling must be a hundred feet high, at least.
At this point, yes. But it tapers away into the distance, see?
Like a pyramid, balanced on its side!
And at the far end — a door, I think. Shall we?
AS THEY MOVE ON:
(WALKING) These pillars, they align perfectly. From this angle they look like a solid wall.
(WALKING) Indeed they do. Wonderful craftsmanship.
(WALKING) Something strange about the carvings on them, though. They don’t seem to be pictures — well, not of anything I recognise. But the shapes don’t repeat enough to make a viable language.
No, it’s not a language — or the TARDIS would have translated it. No clear names, either. Perhaps it’s not a tomb.
It feels like a tomb. Even if it is beautiful.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 16
I wonder...
FX: HIGH PITCHED HUM
HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: The God-King dies, and we mourn in the darkness left behind.
BEAT, THEN REPEATS THROUGH:
A hologram!
A moving fresco. Stand back, Nyssa.
FX: ALIEN FUNERAL MUSIC PLAYS SOFTLY
Those figures, they seem to be carrying something up to the door. I think it’s a body.
Yes, that must be the God-King. This is his funeral cortege, I presume.
Hence the music.
Quite. We might be the first people to see and hear all this in thousands of years, or more.
Incredible. How did you make it work?
These carvings aren’t carvings — they’re photon sensors. Same as the lights in the corridor.
They’re so vivid. If they weren’t so small, you’d think they were real people.
Very sophisticated technology. (WORRIED) I wonder what else these people could do.
So if the carvings control the display...
Let’s try the next one, shall we?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 17
HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: He dies again and we shall rejoice eternally in his divine light! (A BEAT, THEN REPEAT THROUGH: )
Now the mourners are all pointing at the sky.
Yes. A star is forming.
‘His Divine Light’. They must believe he’1ll be reborn as a star.
It’s a common enough belief, but that’s not what the voice said. He ‘dies again’, it said. And that’s a belief peculiar to just one race — the Arrit.
The Arrit?
Just an incredibly advanced and incredibly ancient civilisation. If they’d survived, they might have rivalled the Time Lords in their abilities.
It said their God-King died twice?
Well, they had a very peculiar way of entombing their dead kings. They... (REALISING) Oh no. Stupid! How did I not know?! We have to leave. Right now.
Doctor, are you — (FINDS SHE CAN’T MOVE) Oh!
No time. I’1ll explain when we’re safely a few millennia away. — Well, don’t just stand there, Nyssa!
Doctor, I can’t move!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 18
8: INT. CORRIDOR TO GALLERY ENTRANCE
FX: TWO SETS OF FOOTSTEPS, ONE TRIPS, CLATTER OF STONES
(CRYING OUT, FALLING) Ow!
(QUIET, URGENT) Get up, Heff. Do you want to give us away to those two strangers?
(GETTING UP) Why not? They might know a way out of this place. They might even be able to help.
Feel free to ask them for all the help in the galaxy. Once I’ve shot them.
Don’t be stupid, Mother. They didn’t look remotely dangerous!
FX: ENERGY PISTOL ACTIVATED
You’re kidding. You won’t use that on me.
You think you’re the brains of the family, Heff? So, since you’re so smart, tell me this — what are the odds of there being more than one group in here today?
Fairly small, I suppose.
So they must have followed us in. They must be after the same thing we are.
I don’t know. Maybe...
Maybe? One of your brothers is dead for sure, and we’ve got to assume that something might have happened to Rek too. You think the strangers had nothing to do with that?
I didn’t think of that.
No, you didn’t, did you? So you just help me defend the family against these outsiders. You help me avenge your brothers.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 19
9: INT. GALLERY
FX: NYSSA STRUGGLING, LABOURED BREATHING
You have to try, Nyssa!
I can’t, Doctor. My feet feel so heavy. I can’t lift them! Even moving at all is...
FX: DOCTOR'S FOOTSTEPS RUSHING CLOSER
(LABOURED) No! Stay there. If you get too close, you might get trapped, too.
Stay calm. I need to find out why you can’t move. (LOOKING AROUND) Maybe there’s something in the holograms...
HOLOGRAM-FRESCO:

(THREATENING) Those who would seek the God-King will feel the draw of death. It will come from below. It will fall from above. It will move them back and forward. It will turn their own heart against them. Only those who would die will survive.
That wasn’t very encouraging. But it does tell me one thing — it’s deliberate.
Doctor, please! What’s happening to me?
The hologram was showing this room, only it looked different somehow. The figures were closing the door at the end.
What does it mean?
(TO HIMSELF) It draws from below. I think I know what’s happening, but I can’t believe it. (TO NYSSA) I’m going to throw a stone towards you and then...
FX: SCRAPING OF SMALL STONE BEING PICKED UP
THROWING STONE) Ugh! (FX: LOUD CRACK OF STONE LANDING
Impossible.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 20
(AFRAID, BREATHLESS) It just seemed to freeze in the air, then it fell, like it was being pulled down.
It’s a gravity trap. The local gravity around you is increasing.
It’s getting stronger! I can’t... stand! (COLLAPSES)
Just hold on, Nyssa!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 21
10: INT. UPPER LEVEL CORRIDOR
FX: TWO SETS OF FOOTSTEPS, ONE SIGHTLY OFF
(SLIGHTLY OFF) Hisko, keep up! What you doing back there?
I thought I heard something.
There’s nothing but your imagination! We don’t have time for this.
I was just looking. There’s all these cracks in the rock. Big enough fov...
Forget that. We need to take care of those outsiders.
(GETTING UP) Alright. I’m coming. (MUMBLING) But I did hear it.
If we see them, leave the shooting to me. I know what your aim is like.
(FX: DISTANT INSECTOID CHITTERING, CLICKING SOUNDS, CLEARLY A
NUMBER OF THEM)
See? You hear that? It’s them! More of those giant insect things we met before. — There, at the end of the corridor!
FX: INSECTOID SOUNDS BUILDING
I can handle this.
FX: ENERGY PISTOL POWERING UP
Murs... I don’t think that’s a good idea...
FX: INSECTOID SOUNDS LOUD
Get behind me, Hisko.
FX: ENERGY PISTOL FIRE
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 22
(SHOOTING) Come on, you insect creeps! Come on!
(SHOUTING OVER NOISE) Murs, we have to get out of here!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 23
11: INT. GALLERY
FX: NYSSA GASPING
The gravity... it’s crushing me...!
Hold on, Nyssa! The effect seems to be isolated to those three steps. Think, Doctor, think!
Doctor...!
Wait! Steps, of course! In the hologram where the door was open, there were no steps. This was all a slope.
What... difference...
All the difference, Nyssa! I think I need to open the door, and then the stairs will move into a slope. You’d slide right out of the gravity field.
FX: ENERGY PISTOL POWERING UP BEHIND
(ENTERING) That is a good theory.
Sorry. Bit busy here.
Stay right there.
(IN PAIN) Doctor...!
I don’t know who you are, but my friend needs help. I’m going to the door.
Heff.
FX: ENERGY PISTOL FIRE
There’s no need to shoot! We’re not armed! We’re not here to hurt anybody!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 24
We'll find out the truth of that... (BEAT) .. right after we’ve finished watching your friend die as payment for what you did to my boys.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 25
12: INT. UPPER LEVEL CORRIDOR
(FX: RUNNING AND PANTING OF HISKO, ENERGY PISTOL FIRE,
SOUNDS MORE FRENZIED)
(OFF) Too many insects!
Murs, come on! Come on! — Well, I’m not hanging around. —
RUNS
FX: INSECTOID SOUNDS SLIGHTLY LOUDER
(OFF) Hisko, you coward! Get back here and — (OVERWHELMED BY INSECTS) No! Get back! Aargh!
FX: PISTOL FIRE THROUGH:
FX: FOOTSTEPS SKIDDING TO A HALT
BREATHLESS) Murs. Murs! .. (FX: CHITTERING STOPS; FIRING STOPS
Murs? (BEAT SILENCE) Sorry, Murs. — Still, least I’m alright.
(APPEARING) I wouldn’t say that just yet.
SQUEAKS IN FRIGHT
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 26
13: INT. GALLERY
Doctor... it hurts...
Hold on, Nyssa!
Don’t move.
Please. Just let me get to the door, then we can talk properly. This seems to be a case of mistaken identity.

There’s no point, anyhow. That door doesn’t open. Of course, we weren’t stupid enough to trigger the gravity trap when we first arrived here, but we’ve tried every way we know to open that door. So your theory is wrong. You can’t save her, either way.
Let me try. Please!
I get it now. Don’t you see, Mother? — (RUNNING UP STEPS) You have to trigger the trap to get the door to open!
Quite possibly, yes!
(GASPING) Please! Please...
Heff! Where do you think you’re going!?
(RUNNING, OFF) Proving a point.
Stop right there, boy!
(SLIGHTLY OFF) Come on. (EXERTION) Move!
FX: RUMBLE AND SCRAPING OF STONE DOOR OPENING
It’s working! The steps are moving!
(FX: A LOUDER RUMBLE AS THE STEPS BECOME A SLOPE — AND NYSSA IS
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby
(GASPING, COUGHING) I can mo-ove! (STAGGERS
(RUSHING TO HER) I’ve got you. You’re going
Get up, both of you. And unless you want to you won’t be helping the prisoners again.
I was helping you. I thought you wanted the
(FINAL) Page 27
DOWN SLOPE)
to be alright.
join them, Heff,
door open?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 28
14: INT. UPPER LEVEL CORRIDOR
FX: SHUFFLING FOOTSTEPS OFF, APPROACHING
(OFF, TIRED, IN PAIN) Hisko?
But that’s M—
(SOTTO, WARNING) Stay quiet.
(SOTTO, AFRAID) Who are you?
(SOTTO) Shh!
FX: FOOTSTEPS LOUDER THEN STOP
(SLIGHTLY OFF, SHOUTING) Hisko!
(SOTTO) Whoever you are, lady, Murs ain’t going to hurt you!
Stay quiet, or I’1l hurt him.
(TO HIMSELF) Must have got himself eaten...
FX: FOOTSTEPS RECEDING
(OFF, FADING OUT) Don’t know why Mother brought him... that last husband of hers wasn’t up to much, and the proof’s right there in Hisko. [Still, she won’t be happy if he’s got himself eaten]
FX: FOOTSTEPS FADE OUT
He’s gone. Happy now, whoever you are?
Yes. Now — choose.
Choose? Choose what?
Which way you want to die.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 29
15: INT. GALLERY
You two, move over there.
FX: TWO SETS SHUFFLING FOOTSTEPS
Far enough. Now tell me why you’ve been killing my boys.
(URGENT) You don’t understand. I don’t know who you think we are, and I honestly don’t care. The only thing that’s important is that we all have to get off this ship. Right now.
(RECOVERING) A ship? I thought we were underground...
Heff, search that one. See if she’s got a radio on her.
A radio? I don’t understand...
You and me both. Still.. Hands up, where I can see them.
I’ve told you. We need to get off this ship at once.
I’ve no intention of doing anything but walking through that door, now my son has so helpfully opened it.
Nothing on her. Especially not a radio.
I have to do everything myself? Check her again!
Listen to me! Do you know what this place is?
Heff? Tell him.
Last resting place of the Arrit God-King Tarak-takayo, with all the treasures of an ancient and extinct race. Mother’s been telling me stories about it all my life.
Do those stories mention that it’s not just a tomb?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 30
It’s a treasure house. A repository for all the God-King’s wealth.
No, I meant that it’s a giant floating bomb.
A what?
That’s what the frescoes meant, about the God-King dying twice?
Exactly. When his tomb completes its journey, it explodes with enough power to create a new star. “Bringing light from the darkness”.
It’s nowhere near completing its journey.
Then why has it powered up?
You’re bluffing, trying to save your lives.
Maybe you should — [listen]
(INTERRUPTING) Quiet!
If you won’t listen to me, listen to the ship. Put your ear to a wall. You’ll hear it for yourself. It’s powering up.
As if I’d turn my back on— [you]
(RUSHING TO A WALL) Shh! (BEAT) I can hear it! He’s right! The ship is powering up.
That doesn’t mean...
Listen to your son! We have to get off this ship!
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 31
If you want to die in a supernova-sized explosion... well, I can’t force you to save yourselves. But please, Nyssa and I would like to go.
You killed my sons.
You have proof of that? Of course not.
FX: APPROACHING STAGGERING FOOTSTEPS
Someone else is coming!
(ENTERING) Don’t shoot. Only me.
Murs? What happened to you?
Those insect things, they attacked us.
(REALISING) So where’s Hisko?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 32
16: INT. UPPER LEVEL CORRIDOR
What do you mean, choose to die? I don’t want to die!
This is a tomb. You’ve no business being here if you didn’t come to die.
Please... I didn’t mean to do anything wrong. We came here because Mother told us about it... and then...
Then your brothers began to die.
Please, don’t kill me.

NYSSA: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: They walk the path of trials and pain!
NYSSA: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: The greatest treasure is with the one who offers it to Him.
NYSSA: “The path of trials and pain”? I’m not sure I like the sound of
NYSSA: that.
HISKO: Or the ‘sacrifices’ part. Maybe I should warn Mother.
NYSSA: And the Doctor.
HISKO: Well, they’re all together, aren’t they?
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 51
HISKO: (OVER STATIC) Hello? Mother? It’s me — Hisko. You receiving me? Hello? Heff? Murs? Anyone hearing me? (DEACTIVATES RADIO)
NYSSA: Problems?
HISKO: I don’t think they’re picking me up. Too much interference.
NYSSA: Maybe it’s being caused by those things, when they started up again.
HISKO: You could be right.
NYSSA: I’ll see if I can find a way to switch them off. Why don’t you go over there? — Maybe you could get a better signal away from those things?
HISKO: Good idea. (MOVES AWAY, ACTIVATES RADIO, HEAVY CRACKLE OF STATIC) Mother, it’s me — Hisko. You there?
NYSSA: (OFF) Any luck?
HISKO: Yes, it’s working! (TO RADIO) Hello? You receiving me? It’s Hisko. I’m here with the Doctor’s friend. No problems, but those hologram things have [started talking more —]
HISKO: Hey! What are you doing? Stop! (TO RADIO) Mother! It’s the girl! She’s running away. I’m going after her. Hisko out! (RUNNING, CALLING OUT) Come back! I won’t be angry, honest!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 52
MURS: You catch any of that?
HEFF: It was definitely Hisko. Something about that girl?
DOCTOR: He must mean Nyssa. If anything happens to her...
VIRNA: I bring my family up to know how to behave properly. He’s a good boy, my Hisko. A bit naive, but a good boy. I told him to keep an eye on your friend, that’s what he’1ll do.
MURS: Something up ahead. It looks like... wait, what is that?
DOCTOR: Stay back. Don’t get too close.
HEFF: It’s a body. Or part of one. See? There’s an arm, and — down there — what looks like part of a leg.
MURS: They’re almost rotted away. Must have happened years ago.
HEFF: You ask me, it looks he got melted right into the wall!
DOCTOR: No, not melted...
MURS: Then what?
DOCTOR: That metal probe on your belt. Give it to me.
MURS: What for?
VIRNA: Do it, Murs.
DOCTOR: Alright, stand back. I’m going to throw it onto the floor just im” £LOnt.-Of usc,
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 53
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: DOCTOR THROWS THE PROBE, IMPACT OF METAL ON STONE AS IT
LANDS: )
MURS: Okay. Now what?
DOCTOR: Just wait...
HEFF: It’s... gone.
VIRNA: Vapourised?
DOCTOR: More like teleported, I think.
HEFF: Teleported? To where?
DOCTOR: To a point about three feet to the left of where it was, I think.
HEFF: Three feet? But that would put it...
DOCTOR: Yes. Inside the wall.
MURS: Wait, then this body here...
DOCTOR: The remains of someone who triggered the trap and was partially teleported into the solid material of the wall.
HEFF: Nasty. I wonder who they were.
VIRNA: Someone who didn’t survive to find the treasure before us. That’s all I care about. We can’t go this way. The other way... (FX: TAKES A COUPLE STEPS) is a dead end. Looks like you took us the wrong way, Doctor.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 54
DOCTOR: Wait! Look at this junction point. There should be some more— yes, here they are. — Interesting. The sound symbols are mirror
DOCTOR: images of each other. This one.. and this one.
MURS: Meaning?
DOCTOR: Meaning that if we go this way, we end up going that way.
VIRNA: Make sense. Now.
DOCTOR: I don’t suppose anyone would care to volunteer...?
VIRNA: Move it.
MURS: Now what?
HEFF: He’s gone!
VIRNA: Idiot! He’s probably in the wall as well!
HEFF: Hey! He’s in the opposite corridor!
DOCTOR: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) Quite. It’s the only way past the trap. Walk the wrong way to take the right way. Ingenious, really.
MURS: Let’s go!
VIRNA AND DOCTOR: Wait!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 55
VIRNA: Stupid boys! One at a time, if you want to get there in one piece.
DOCTOR: She’s right. The teleport might splice you together.
MURS: (PUSHING IN FRONT) I’m going first.
MURS: (SLIGHTLY OFF) Haha! It works!
VIRNA: Heff! We don’t have all day.
HEFF: Hold on. There’s something else here — markings, scratched into the stone.
VIRNA: Who cares? Move it.
HEFF: I think that guy must have made them to mark his trail, just before he walked into that trap. Funny thing is, they look a lot like the ones we use.
DOCTOR: Really? Now that is interesting.
VIRNA: Lots of plunder crews use trail markers, Heff.
HEFF: With the same kind of code signs we use? Thought they were Supposed to be an old family secret?
VIRNA: Just get moving! (PUSHES HIM)
VIRNA: (FX: HE STUMBLES FORWARD, THEN POWER-BUILD UP, VAPOURISATION BLAST)
HEFF: (APPEARING) Ugh. You didn’t need to push me! I just thought it was interesting.
DOCTOR: (TO HIMSELF) Yes. Very interesting...
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 56
MURS: You hear that, Heff?
HEFF: I did, yeah.
DOCTOR: What was that, that sound?
VIRNA: . Bugs. Great big insect things, the place is full of them. Alright, boys — go let off some steam.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 57
HISKO: (RUNNING, CALLING OUT) Come back! Please! It isn’t safe in these tunnels!
NYSSA: (OFF, RUNNING) No! I’ve got to find the Doctor and warn him what those holograms said!
HISKO: (RUNNING, CALLING OUT) Then just stop, and we can do it together. I promise! My mother and brothers are in there too, remember? You think I don’t care about them?
NYSSA: (OFF, RUNNING) How do I know I can trust you?
HISKO: (RUNNING, CALLING OUT) Good question. Hmmm. Okay, wait. Just listen.
HISKO: (STOPS RUNNING, CALLING OUT) There, you hear that? That was me throwing my blaster away, to prove I’m not a threat to you. That was a crazy thing to do, wasn’t it? Us all alone down here in a place as dangerous as this ship, and now I’m not even armed.
NYSSA: (OFF, STOPS) Yes, I suppose it was.
HISKO: (WALKING, CALLING OUT) Right. Now I’m walking toward a turn in the passage. You hear me coming? Don’t panic when you see me, okay?
NYSSA: (OFF) I understand.
HISKO: (WALKING, CALLING OUT) Okay, I’m coming round now. (BEAT, NO
LONGER: CALLING OUT) There, you see? No blaster. Can I come closer?
NYSSA: Yes.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 58
HISKO: (WALKING TO HER) See? I’m not going to do anything. Hey, what do you say we start over, as if none of this had happened, only this time we— [SUDDEN SURPRISE] Oh.
NYSSA: What’s the matter?
HISKO: Listen, I don’t want to alarm you...
NYSSA: Alarm me? You hold me hostage and chase me through these tunnels, but you don’t want to alarm me?
HISKO: Behind you! There’s a dead body lying behind you!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 59
MURS: (CALLING OUT, FIRING, OFF) Yeah, you like that? Not so much fun when there’s two of us and we’re ready for you, is it?
HEFF: (CALLING OUT, FIRING, OFF) Murs! More of them, that opening to the left!
MURS: (CALLING OUT, FIRING, OFF) Thanks, big brother. Hey, you see the way that one’s head flew right off?
DOCTOR: Lovely boys. You must be so proud.
VIRNA: They listen to their mother, always do what they’re told — well, one of them does, anyway — I can trust them.
MURS: (CALLING OUT, OFF) Alright, they’re scarpering. You can come up now.
VIRNA: See? Who needs recruits, when you’ve got family. Let’s go.
DOCTOR: (FOLLOWING) Right behind you. Unfortunately.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 60
HISKO: Watch it! Don’t get too close!
NYSSA: To a dead body? What do you think it’1l do?
HISKO: Well, you know... all the traps in this place...
NYSSA: The Doctor and I found a body earlier, but this one’s different.
HISKO: Really? How?
NYSSA: This one’s much better preserved, for a start — (BREAKING OFF, IN DISGUST) Ugh, look at its hand!
HISKO: It’s holding a plasma blaster. A nice one.
NYSSA: No, the other one.
HISKO: Oh, yuck. His fingers are worn away to the bone!
NYSSA: And those scratch marks on the walls around it...
HISKO: It looks like...
NYSSA: Like he was trying to claw his way through stone with his bare hands! (BEAT) I don’t like this.
HISKO: Neither do I. Let’s go back.
HISKO: Uh-oh.
NYSSA: What is that?
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 61
HISKO: They’re big, got too many legs and they bite. That’s all you need to know. Don’t worry — a few plasma blaster shots usually sends them packing.
NYSSA: Except you threw your blaster away, remember?
HISKO: Back there—
NYSSA: Where the sound of those things is coming from.
HISKO: The blaster that corpse is holding. It still looks usable.
NYSSA: Hisko, no!
HISKO: (MOVING) It’s alright. Just stand back, no point in us both— [risking our necks]
HISKO: (MUFFLED, BANGING ON ENERGY SHIELD) Hey, what’s going on?
NYSSA: It’s a trap! You’re caught inside a force field!
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) But you know how to get me out, right?
NYSSA: I’m not sure. Maybe if I— [had more time]
NYSSA: Those things, they’re coming!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 62
VIRNA: See? My boys can take care of themselves.
DOCTOR: (IN DISTASTE) That smell...
MURS: Yeah, pong a bit when you fry them with hot plasma.
HEFF: They’re all over the ship. What are they, anyway?
VIRNA: Space parasites. Bit like the, what were they called? — Wirrn. I remember one time when I was salvaging this old asteroid mining platform, turned out to be full of Wirrn—
DOCTOR: (INTERRUPTING) They’re Arrit-ko.
HEFF: (INCREDULOUS) Arrit? You mean the things that built this ship?
DOCTOR: No. Arrit-ko. It means ‘slaves of the Arrit’. Genetically engineered to live aboard this ship and serve its occupant.
VIRNA: Occupant. You mean a corpse, in a tomb.
DOCTOR: Yes. The Arrit god-king. They guard its tomb. Repel invaders. Carry out simple maintenance. Oh, and generally worship it.
MURS: Worship?
DOCTOR: The Arrit thought their kings were gods, even after they died. All alone and drifting through space for thousands of years? A god needs his worshippers—
DOCTOR: —at least until it was time for the ship to go supernova and
DOCTOR: transform a god-king into a god-star.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 63
DOCTOR: Speaking of which...
MURS: What is that?
HEFF: Feels like retro-engines firing. Big ones.
DOCTOR: That’s exactly what it is. Like it’s slowing down...
DOCTOR: . and changing course. but why would it be doing that? (BEAT) Virna, when you found this thing, how deep into interstellar Space was it?
VIRNA: Interstellar? No, we only detected it after it entered this system. Otherwise, we could have spent years more— [looking for ats
DOCTOR: (INTERRUPTING) System! Which one? Not an inhabited one. Please tell me that.
VIRNA: Does it matter?
DOCTOR: Matter? A planetary system, possibly with inhabitants, and there’s a supernova bomb floating toward them? Yes, I'd say it matters.
VIRNA: It’s one of the Vespertine Cluster systems. And, yes, it’s inhabited. That’s why we knew we had to get aboard fast, before any of the locals made a grab for it.
DOCTOR: The tomb. We have to get to it as soon as possible.
MURS: Isn’t that what we’ve been doing? That’s where the treasure is, right?
DOCTOR: I don’t care about the treasure!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 64
VIRNA: Good. More for us. I like the way you do business, Doctor.
DOCTOR: The control systems must be in there. That’s all I want to find.
VIRNA: Why?
DOCTOR: Because, if we can’t get off this ship before it explodes, then I need to try to get it back into deep space, to save every living thing in this star system. Is that alright with you?
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 65
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Help me! Get me out of here!
NYSSA: Hisko, you’ve got to stay calm. Look around you. Look for something that might release the force field.
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Like the corpse of the last person who died in it, you mean?!
NYSSA: Those things are getting closer. Please, Hisko, you have to look!
HISKO: I don’t see anything!
NYSSA: Maybe it’s not a trap, maybe it’s saving you from thenm...
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Nyssa!
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Stupid empty pistol, small wonder you died! Nyssa, look out!
NYSSA: No!
JHANNI: (APPEARING) Arrit-Ko, tar-ka-rey! Rit-a! Nu-ji-rit-a!
JHANNI: (FX: INSECTOID EXCITED FRENZY, CHANGES TO REPEATED CHANTING NOISE, AND RECEDES)
NYSSA: (ALARMED) Who are you? How did you do that?!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 66
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) It’s her! The woman who took me prisoner!
JHANNI: His name was Bress. He died here, alone and in the dark, left behind by those he trusted. (BEAT) I wonder what will happen to you.
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Hey, it’s me — Hisko. You let me go before, remember? I need some help here.
JHANNI: I can’t help you.
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) You can’t just leave me here! Why save us and then leave me here?!
JHANNI: Don’t you want to die like Bress did?
NYSSA: Of course he doesn’t!
JHANNI: So you wouldn’t sacrifice yourself? To save your family?
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) What?!
JHANNI: Would you sacrifice yourself for them?
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED) Nyssa?
JHANNI: (FIERCE) Answer!
HISKO: (FORCE FIELD MUFFLED, UPSET) Yes! I’d do it. Just... make it quick!
JHANNI: There. You’re free.
HISKO: It’s gone!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 67
NYSSA: I don’t understand.
JHANNI: Why would you? Now, come with me.
HISKO: Where?
JHANNI: To the god-king. For a family reunion.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 68
HEFF: (SLIGHTLY OFF) Ready, Heff?
MURS: (SLIGHTLY OFF) If you are.
VIRNA: No heroics, okay? (QUIETER, TO DOCTOR) You better be sure about this, Doctor. I’m risking the lives of my boys here.
DOCTOR: I’m sure. See these holograph symbols on the walls that keep changing shape? They’re equations. The Arrit used them as a divine expression of the mathematical laws of nature, which they could then use to, well, break them. Gravity, light... all represented as symbols. Symbols we can [use]
VIRNA: (INTERRUPTING, IMPATIENT) Doctor... we don’t need a maths lesson. Just point the way!
DOCTOR: These symbols correspond to the patterns on the floor, showing safe routes across this chamber, following the footsteps of divine law.
MURS: (CALLING OUT, SLIGHTLY OFF) He still going on...?
DOCTOR: We have to wait for the holograms to shift to the right sequence, otherwise the whole room’s still a death trap!
MURS: (CALLING OUT, SLIGHTLY OFF) What does that even mean?
VIRNA: You do what he says, boys! He’s kept us alive this far.
DOCTOR: Alright, they’re changing... Murs — two symbols forward, then three to the left. Go!
MURS: (OFF, RUNNING) Watch this!
DOCTOR: Heff — four forward, then one right. Go!
HEFF: (INTERRUPTING, OFF, RUNNING) —four forward, one right. Made it!
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 69
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: CRASHES AND RUMBLES, ENERGY BLASTS AND FAST-MOVING
MACHINERY: )
DOCTOR: (OVER NOISE) Don’t stop! Keep following your patterns!
VIRNA: (OVER NOISE) What’s happening?
DOCTOR: (OVER NOISE) The room, it’s trying to catch them. But they’1l be safe as long as they keep to the pattern I showed them.
VIRNA: (CALLING OUT) To your right, Heff! Right!
HEFF: (OFF, CALLING OUT, MOVING) I see it!
DOCTOR: (TO HIMSELF) Neo-Classic Arrit cuneiform, with a few Osirian
DOCTOR: algorithms thrown in, just for fun. Very clever...
VIRNA: (CALLING OUT) Faster, Murs! Keep moving!
MURS: (OFF) That was close.
VIRNA: (CALLING OUT) Keep going! (TO DOCTOR) Doctor?
DOCTOR: Almost... (HOLOGRAM SYMBOLS ACTIVATING) There!
VIRNA: They did it. They’re at the door! It’s safe to go across now, yes?
DOCTOR: It should be. The floor’s deactivated now, so— [there’s nothing that]
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 70
DOCTOR WHO: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: The seekers have passed the first trials.
VIRNA: Seekers?
DOCTOR: Sssh. Listen!
DOCTOR: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: An offering must be made.
VIRNA: You said it was s-[afe!]
VIRNA: (FX: POWERFUL FORCE FIELD ACTIVATING. FROM HERE ON THEY’RE HELD IN A SORT OF ELECTRONIC BUBBLE)
VIRNA: What... what is it.. (FX: ENERGY CRACKLING) Oooow!
DOCTOR: Interesting. A force field’s sprung up around us. I wouldn’t advise touching the side of it.
VIRNA: Easier said than done. — Look! My boys, they’re trapped too!
DOCTOR: Why two force fields, I wonder? It’s not exactly an ecomonical use of the ship’s power reserves.
DOCTOR: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: An offering must be made. Choose.
VIRNA: What... what does it mean? ‘Choose’?
DOCTOR: Oh no...
DOCTOR: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: Choose.
VIRNA: Doctor?
DOCTOR: You’re trying to get into the tomb of a god. Gods require sacrifices.
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 71
DOCTOR WHO: HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: Choose.
DOCTOR: We have to choose. You and I, or your two sons — two of us have to die, for the other two to go free.
DOCTOR: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 72

HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: An offering must be made. Choose.
Doctor?
You’re trying to get into the tomb of a god. Gods require sacrifices.

We have to choose. You and I, or your two sons — two of us have to die, for the other two to go free.
31: INT. LOWER DECK — OPEN TRAP-FILLED AREA [CONT]
FX: INSIDE FORCE FIELD
That can’t be what it means.
How long have you been on this ship, Virna? How many people have you lost? That’s exactly what it means.
You did this. You said it was safe.
FX: HOLOGRAM ACTIVATING
I’m as trapped as you are.
Symbols, yet more of those holograms.
The one on the left is us. The one on the right is your sons.
HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: Choose.
FX: FORCE FIELD INTENSIFYING

Get back!

FX: INSIDE FORCE FIELD — SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT TONE
. I told you, get back. You saw the burn it gave me.
I’m trying to see Mother. Do you think she’s alright?
Mother? She’1ll be fine, Murs. Looking after number one, that’s what she’s best at.
Wait... I can see her. What’s she doing?
She’s waving at us. There. She’s fine.
What’s that in her hand?
Her radio. She wants to buzz us!
Hold on...
FX: RADIO STATIC
There’s too much interference. Must be from this thing around
us.
Quiet! I hear something...
FX: HEAVY RADIO STATIC, INDISTINCT VOICE OF VIRNA
Hello, Mother? Yes... yes! I can hear you, just!
FX: HEAVY RADIO STATIC, INDISTINCT VOICE OF VIRNA
I understand. Murs out. (SWITCHES OFF RADIO)
So? What did she say?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 75

TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 76
33: INT. LOWER DECK — OPEN TRAP-FILLED AREA [CONT]
FX: INSIDE FORCE FIELD
Are you going to lower your gun now?
Kept you quiet, didn’t it?
What did you tell them that for? You heard me tell you there’s no way out, nothing I can do; no equations to solve!?
They’re my boys. If I tell them everything’s going to be alright, then that’s what they’1ll believe. I haven’t much else to offer them but a mother’s words of comfort.
(IN DISBELIEF) Before you kill them?

That’s what mothers do for their children. They pretend they’11l be fine; that when you’re there, nothing bad can happen. I’m just not the kind who actually believes it. Sometimes, sacrifices have to be made. For the family.
You’d let them die?!
Them or us, Doctor. Who do you think’s more important?
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 77
34: INT. DUCTING
(FX: NYSSA, HISKO, JHANNI CRAWLING ALONG NARROW PASSAGEWAYS, GRILLES ON FLOOR, OCCASIONAL BURSTS OF STEAM — NEW ATMOS)
(CRAWLING) How did you do that before? You spoke to those things, and they understood you.
(CRAWLING) Did I?
(CRAWLING) Yes! You spoke to them in a language they understood. Don’t you remember?
(CRAWLING) I...
(STOPS) Wait! That sound. You hear it?
FX: LOW INSECTOID NOISE, OFF
Yes. It sounds like... like... them!
They’re down here with us.
The Arrit-ko. They’ve lived in these tunnels for centuries.
How? I mean, what do they live on?
Each other. Unless some tasty tomb raider comes along. — We’re passing their main nesting hives.
I thought you brought us down here to get away from them!
You’re safe here. They won’t get you, not if you stick close to me.
They’re afraid of you, aren’t they? — That armour you’re wearing, it’s chitin shell. You’re wearing parts of their bodies.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 78
(TO JHANNI) Who are you? Do we get to know that?
Jhanni. My name’s Jhanni.

Since I was left here to die.

(SUDDENLY ALERT) There. Do you feel it?

(BREAKING OFF, MOVING) Come on. We have to hurry.

The ship. It’s caught someone, and it’s about to kill them.
TOMB SHIP by Gordon Rennie & Emma Beeby (FINAL) Page 79
35: INT. LOWER DECK — OPEN TRAP-FILLED AREA
FX: POWERFUL FORCE FIELD BUZZ
You can’t be serious. You’d sacrifice your own sons...?!
I’ve lost two sons already since we came aboard, not to mention... (BREAKS OFF) .. well, never mind that now...
HOLOGRAM-FRESCO: Choose.
FX: FORCE FIELD SUDDENLY INTENSIFYING, THEN DYING DOWN

Think about it — we don’t choose, and they’1l die anyway. And if we choose them to escape instead of us, how long do you think they’1ll survive, without us to keep them alive? They’re as good as dead, no matter what.

Like you’ve got a choice. I’m pressing that symbol.
Then you’1l have to get past me first.

What are they doing?
It looks like.. it looks like they’re fighting!
Fighting against Mother? That Doctor must be a braver man than any of our dads!
There’s something not right here, Murs.
The Doctor, I knew he wasn’t to be trusted.
I don’t know...
Mother will sort him out.
It’s getting serious. She’s aiming her blaster at him now.
Is she? Let me see! (BEAT) So she is. She won’t shoot him... will she?

FX: INSIDE FORCE FIELD
Out of my way, Doctor. I will kill you. Don’t imagine I won't.
You'll have to, because it’s the only way you’1ll get past me to that symbol.
